TopicTitle: Anyone else see the irony in this?

Articles.Content:
1.0 "eeeep my pod is flipping over"

http://www.space.com/29243-russian-cargo-spacecraft-malfunction-progress59.html#ooid=93dnVydDqutYztk7VI98qPYjIjFNy zYb
Looks like they sent up a probe core which didn't have SAS enabled!

Not many people realize that in order to not flip the capsule you need to have the CoM on the bottom and get a good angle of attack.

There's an issue that heatshields are considered massless, so they don't push the CoM below and thus the capsule is less stable
